item.title: Higher-Order Components (HOCs) in React
item.description: Understanding Higher-Order Components: Link to heading A Higher-Order Component (HOC) is a function that takes a component and returns a new component with enhanced capabilities. In essence, HOCs are a way to share behavior or functionality among React components. They are a crucial part of React’s composability and code reusability. Why Use HOCs? Link to heading 1. Reusability Link to heading HOCs allow you to encapsulate and share standard functionality across different components.
